column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=1 .
#Text=Introduction
#Text=Food digestion within the gastrointestinal tract is a good example for biofermentation processes in our daily life , in which many different types of microorganisms can be involved .
#Text=Without microbes , large and complex food molecules cannot be broken down into required nutrients for the human body .
#Text=In the food-research sector , complex microbial interactions have been studied to enhance , for instance , the aroma profile and flavor in soy sauce during the fermentation process .
#Text=As another example , microorganisms play a major role in coffee fermentation by degrading the mucilage to alcohols , acids , and enzymes .
#Text=In agricultural biogas plants , various types of bacteria contribute to the conversion of biomass ( e. g. , maize silage ) into a usable energy source ( e. g. , methane gas ) .

#Text=In all applications of bioreactor technology , the on-line monitoring of the metabolic activity of microorganisms should be seriously considered to avoid undesired , time-consuming , and cost-intensive interventions , which can reduce the yield at the end of the production chain .

#Text=Related fields of application include : cell health monitoring in bioreactors , continuous non-invasive monitoring of cell growth in disposable bioreactors , on-line near-infrared bioreactor monitoring of cell density , online monitoring of cell concentration in high-cell density Escherichia coli cultivations , sensing metabolites for monitoring the tissue-engineered cellularity in perfusion bioreactors , and micro-biosensors for fed-batch fermentation with integrated online monitoring .

#Text=In all of those examples , analytical sensors are the enabling element for rapid , sensitive , and cost-effective detection of various parameters ( e. g. , health , growth , and density of cells in bioreactors ) .
#Text=In this context , light-addressable potentiometric sensors ( LAPS ) can be applied as suitable tools for monitoring the extracellular acidification of cells .
#Text=A LAPS is a field-effect-based chemical sensor with the ability to monitor concentration changes of biochemical/biological species in a spatially resolved way .
#Text=It belongs to the family of electrolyte/insulator/semiconductor ( EIS)-based capacitive sensors .

#Text=By addressing defined regions of interest on a sensor chip with modulated light beams such as laser-diode modules , two-dimensional ( 2D ) chemical images of concentration distributions can be recorded .

#Text=In comparison to other 2D potentiometric chemical imaging sensors applying e. g. , arrays of ion-sensitive field-effect transistors ( ISFETs ) or charge-coupled devices ( CCDs ) , LAPS require no sensor patterns to record chemical images :

#Text=The LAPS surface does not require pattering , wiring or passivation , which allows bacteria to come directly into contact with the pH-sensitive transducer layer to determine the extracellular acidification .
#Text=Furthermore , on its planar sensor surface , multi-chamber structures can be attached to perform differential measurements with distinct cell suspensions .

#Text=The principle of differential measurements allows elimination of unwanted external influences such as sensor signal drift and pH value variations of the measurement solution during experiments .

#Text=Beside the chemical imaging technique visualizing the pH distribution on the sensor surface , there are a variety of further LAPS sensing techniques such as the scanned light-pulse technique ( SLPT ) in studies of interface properties ( e. g . , flat-band voltage ) , or scanning photo-induced impedance microscopy ( SPIM ) analyzing impedance changes e. g . , in PAH/PSS polyelectrolyte microcapsules labeled with Au nanoparticles .

#Text=The equivalent circuit diagram for designing the LAPS set-up consists of three key parts ( illumination area , non-illumination area , and an external circuit ) , which are described in details in .
#Text=The sensor fabrication steps are described in Section 2.1 .
#Text=Explanations about LAPS operation modes ( e. g. , constant-bias , constant-current , potential-tracking , and phase-mode ) can be found in .

#Text=A few examples of on-going research for LAPS-based biosensing are the determination of the extracellular acidification of Escherichia coli , and differential imaging of the metabolism of bacteria and eukaryotic cells .

#Text=In this regard , quantitative differential monitoring of the metabolic activity of Corynebacterium glutamicum , and image detection of yeast Saccharomyces cerevisiae have been recently discussed .

#Text=Correspondingly , dual functional extracellular recording for better signal transduction , and monitoring secretion of adrenal chromaffin cells by local extracellular acidification are further applications .

#Text=In this work and for the first time , the extracellular acidification of three model microorganisms , namely Escherichia coli ( E. coli ) K12 , Corynebacterium glutamicum ( C. glutamicum ) ATCC13032 , and Lactobacillus brevis ( L. brevis ) ATCC 14869 is assessed simultaneously by means of a four-chamber differential LAPS set-up by varying the cell number and/or glucose concentration .
#Text=These model microorganisms were selected , as acid-forming , facultative anaerobe , easy-to-cultivate , and commonly used bacteria in laboratory and industrial applications .
#Text=Both E. coli and C. glutamicum have been studied in separate LAPS experiments recently , however , the cellular metabolism of L. brevis has not been analyzed by LAPS so far .

#Text=In a first experimental step , the extracellular acidification of L. brevis cells has been evaluated : calibration curves were established , which render the potential-change rate as a function of glucose concentration and cell number .
#Text=Data were compared with results of already in literature discussed microorganisms such as E. coli and C. glutamicum .
#Text=Finally , a novel parallelized measurement procedure is introduced , which allows sequentially and simultaneously performed LAPS measurements with all three types of bacteria .
